contents.item: This is part of what a family is about, not just love. It's knowing that your family will be there watching out for you. Nothing else will give you that. Not money. Not fame. Not work.

What is home? My favorite definition is "a safe place," a place where one is free from attack, a place where one experiences secure relationships and affirmation. It's a place where people share and understand each other. Its relationships are nurturing. The people in it do not need to be perfect; instead, they need to be honest, loving, supportive, recognizing a common humanity that makes all of us vulnerable.
contents.owner: Gladys M. Hunt, Honey for a Child's Heart: The Imaginative Use of Books in Family Life

contents.item: The knowledge that she would never be loved in return acted upon her ideas as a tide acts upon cliffs.
contents.owner: Thornton Wilder, The Bridge of San Luis Rey

contents.item: Traveling in the company of those we love is home in motion.

With friends, if you keep making an effort to reach out and you keep getting hurt, you eventually stop trying. But it's much harder to give up on family. Somewhere deep down you want it to work so badly that you keep making the same mistake over and over again.
So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty.

All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
contents.owner: Mitch Albom, The Five People You Meet in Heaven

contents.item: The heart wants what it wants, Dolp. You don't plan on making your life complicated, it just happens,and you don"t do it on purpose, and you don't do it to hurt people who love you. It just turns out that way sometimes.

contents.item: A brother is like gold and a friend is like diamond. If gold cracks you can melt it and make it just like it was before. If a diamond cracks, it can never be like it was before.
I am overwhelmed by the grace and persistence of my people.
Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
